channel.title: Windows on MyThinkPond
channel.description: Recent content in Windows on MyThinkPond

item.title: Remove .DS_Store and ._.DS_Store under Windows
item.description: What is this article about? When you move from a Mac OSX onto Windows, the file system will contain two files under every directory labeled “.DS_Store” and “._.DS_Store”. These files are not useful especially if you’re trying to commit code under a Git source control. It can sometime get very annoying and to eliminate this “noise” from your day to day development, you may want to remove these artifacts from your Windows system.

item.title: **fix** VirtualBox installer fails on Windows 11 (program compatibility issue)
item.description: What is this article about? When you try to install VirtualBox v.6.1.30 on Windows 11, you will see the following error: This app can't run on this device: This app can’t run because it causes security performance issue on Windows. A new version may be available. Check with your software provider for an updated version that runs on this version of Windows. It will further prevent you from executing the installer.

item.title: Developing email applications on Windows, targeted for Linux environment - email, mailx, sendmail
item.description: If you’re developing on a Windows platform for an application targeted for Linux or Unix that deals with email, then this article will be useful. Let us begin byÂ understand the problem. Problem If you are a Java/Spring developer, (developing in Java is platform independent - runs on any platform where a JVM is available) then you have two options in front of you for sending emails from a Java application:
